summary: Favorite Crowley image?
question: Favorite Crowley image?
answer:
Oh, Nonnie, do you know what you’re asking? Do you? You think I can narrow it down? Actually, I think you know what you’re doing. I’m betting that you’re betting I can’t, in fact, pick just one. And if that’s the case, the question now becomes, who owes whom?

*cracks knuckles* here we go…

Technically, this should probably count as an image of Mark, but if you wanna fight me on it…

Adding this one because lolz

Should we get into the gifs? Yeah, you’re right.

(Just ask me how I feel about ANY image of him in chains, tbh)

I crack up every time I see this one, and I see it quite regularly (not calling anyone out. You know who you are and I love you for it)

And it seems I’ve maxed out on images. Dammit. Thanks, Nonnie, this was fun!

It’s ironic…as a kid, I dreamed about Prince Charming. As a grown ass adult, I lust after the King of Hell.

summary: Crossroad Deals
body:
Crossroad Deals

What would happen if someone made a crossroads deal with Crowley and asked to be turned straight into a demon when Crowley collects, be his second in command and no one (including Crowley) is allowed to kill him for at least 100 years? That just sounds like a cool deal.

summary: Revolution - Chapter 47 (Supernatural fic)
title: Revolution - Chapter 47 (Supernatural fic)
body:
Chapter Summary: Crowley has something to tell you and Mary suggests an alliance.

Chapter Warnings: Smut, lots of smut. Angst

Chapter 47 - Overruled

(Proof reading errors likely)

A/N: This is a long ass chapter guys, Strap in.

________

“Oh Crowleyyyyy,” Lucifer had cooed to him telepathically as Crowley fucked you hard on the throne. “Let’s have a private chat, devil to demon.”

“Get stuffed,” Crowley thought back. “Busy here.”

“You’re gonna listen because I know you still haven’t told her about her parents yet,” comes the derisive response. “This will be the last time you touch her. Let me out of the bonds of this vessel and I’ll spare your miserable existence. Don’t and I’ll sing like a canary.”

“Go ahead,” Crowley mentally shrugs. “Try it.”

He watches Lucifer bluster for a split second before an expression of rage comes over his face and then he focuses his attention back to you.

Crowley knew he was trying to converse with you in a similar manner. He couldn’t read your thoughts any more because of it. He just hoped you’d be strong enough to resist his charms this time.

He uses his essence to help your orgasm along, trying to rip you out of the internal conversation and he grunts as he feels you clench and pulse around him. Then he can hear your thoughts again.

“He’s never going to stop,” you kept thinking over and over. “He’ll never stop until he has me.”

Of all the things in creation that you’d fought, Crowley knew Lucifer’s obsession with you scared you the most. Not even a display like this had been a big enough clue for the idiot feather duster that you didn’t want him.

Then he found his own release, his cock twitching inside you. You always felt marvellous around him. So tight, so willing.

Then Crowley’s mouth gets the better of him and he’s in a war of words with Lucifer, causing the archangel to bristle. That seemed to make you stiffen to an unnatural degree before Crowley leaned around and saw your eyes glaze over.

“If it saves the world Dean, what choice do I have? I’ll go with him,” you say dully.

“I wonder if she’s talking about little old me,” Lucifer grins cheekily, looking at Crowley out of the tops of his eyes. “I’d like to think she’d come round to my way of thinking eventually.”

“I don’t want to run. Don’t make me,” you start picking up speed in your babbling and Crowley knew he needed to get you out before Lucifer took this as a sign of victory.

He appeared with you in the bedroom, quite beside himself with worry as he held you close, listening to horrible things that you were predicting. They were things that told him there was a choice to make, a choice to save humanity but it was likely that either meant you went with Lucifer or Crowley died. Neither of those were appealing. Neither of those he could bear to listen to as you sounded like you were imitating a sobbing voice, your voice from the future.

Well….bloody hell.



**



After your phone conversation with Dean, Crowley seems to be looking at you intensely.

“Darling, there’s something I need to tell you,” Crowley starts.

“What did you do this time?” you automatically say, feeling your stomach flip. “You never use that voice unless you messed up.”

“It’s something I found out very very recently,” he sighs. “I just needed to confirm if it was true or not.”

“Tell me.”

“Tabitha, this might change things between us.”

“I feel like I’m in this for the long game now,” you laugh a little bitterly. “So just get it over with. Who is she?”

“Excuse me?” Crowley blinks. “Who is who?”

“Oh,” your eyes widen. “Okay, you didn’t stray then, that’s something.”

“Why on earth would I do that, you certifiable woman?” Crowley is bewildered. “Why would that even enter your mind?”

“Something Lucifer said to me just now,” you bite your lip, looking at the sheets.

“Is he speaking to you telepathically?” Crowley becomes very angry. “Abominable git! Pet, you are the top of the chain and why would I try and find anything as good as that when there isn’t? No I haven’t betrayed you. This is to do with your parents.”

“What about them?”

“I mean your real parents,” Crowley sighs again. “Before you and Alistair were adopted.”

“You mean….did you….did you kill them or something?”

“Your mother, she made a deal,” Crowley tells you. “She couldn’t have children, see. She asked for ten years of fertility so I gave them to her. That’s how you and your brother came to be. When it was time to collect….there were more casualties than was expected. It was the Marchioness disaster.”

“So you’re saying you had a hand in my birth?” you try and wrap your head around it. “I’m not sure whether that’s creepy or fate at this point.”

“You know, I was expecting rather more shouting than is currently happening,” Crowley surveys you.

“I…I don’t know,” you shrug. “I never knew my birth parents. It would be unfair of me to get angry over something like this. You didn’t know I would be the product of it. I can’t hate you for a decision my mother made.”

You’d never seen the King of Hell relax as much as he did. Crowley almost fell back into the sheets with relief.

“Darling, I love you. You are just the most exquisite example of mortal divinity.”

“If you’re going to suggest they’ll make me a saint again after I die, I’ll throw this pillow at you,” you scowl. “I’m nobody’s angel. I just fucked a demon in front of the devil.”

“That you did,” Crowley purrs, running a hand along your waist. “Very bold and very brave. I know he was trying to speak to you most of the time. Is he saying anything now?”

“Only the usual,” you mutter. “That he’ll kill you, he’ll kill the Winchesters and I’ll be some queen of the dawn or other.”

“Not if I kill him first,” Crowley grumbles. “I’ll pluck him and roast him like a Christmas turkey.”

You wince, hearing that saccharin voice of Lucifer’s invading your head again.

Tabbbbbbyyyyyyyyy, oh my little cutesy wutesy little kitty cat? Answer me baby. Did you like my show for you? I promise you, tonight’s will be even better.

“He won’t shut up,” you hiss, clenching your hands over your ears. “I feel like I’m going mad.”

“Let’s get you out of Hell. Distance will help,” Crowley frowns, redressing you with a snap of his fingers and then vanishing with you back into the bunker.

Immediately the archangel’s voice dims to where you can’t even make out individual words. The relief was immense.

“Thank you,” you say earnestly. “Being a prophet sucks balls.”

“Such an interesting turn of phrase,” Crowley chuckles. “And yes, I’ll never forgive God for pulling that little stunt.”

There’s a flash where you see Crowley in the grey world, screaming in agony before it’s gone just as suddenly as it started. The more you keep seeing, the more you’re certain you’re going to lose him. You just want to shirk all your hunter responsibilities, spend as much time with Crowley as you can. Then a mad idea comes to you.

“Take me again,” you nip at his neck.

“Already? Darling,  I’m not a machine.”

“So you’re not up to it?” you tease.

“I may not be a machine but I am Crowley and I am always up for ravishing you. What’s brought this mood on?”

“I just need you again.”

There’s a click and you’re disrobed before you practically pounce on him. He seems shocked at first but he play fights with you, pinning you to the bed with his demonic essence.

“Wicked girl,” he smirks. “And all mine.”

“Crowley, just fuck me,” you beg.

“How can I refuse such a pretty request like that?”

You’re still slick from the sex you had earlier and he has no trouble gliding his cock into you, stretching you out around him.

“But let’s aim for a quickie,” he whispers in your ear. “I’m fairly certain there’s the Winchester brood not so far away and your old colleagues.”

“Then come on,” you grab his hips, urging him to roll forward.

“Very very eager,” he purrs. “My my.”

He covers your mouth with his hand before taking an almost feral pace. He’s driving himself home, desperately trying to keep his own sounds to small groans and curse words in a language you don’t understand.

“Let’s take the quick method for you, my love,” he rasps and you can see the tendrils of his power snake across your body, feeling like hands were pawing at every inch of you. “Come now, I want to feel you shake in my arms.”

He mouths at your neck, leaving tiny bites in his wake until you jerk, your orgasm barrelling across you as you half scream into his palm.

“Oh I do love those noises you make, kitten,” he groans. “I shan’t be far behind.”

“Crowley, do what you did when Lucifer was riding shotgun,” you say seriously. “Switch off the thing that makes you infertile.”

He stops dead, looking horrified, “Absolutely not! Are you bloody mad?! I almost killed you the last time!”

“And Chuck said I wouldn’t have survived that time but didn’t say I would never survive it,” you argue. “Please.”

“Why are you so insistent, darling?” he looks grave.

“Because I’m scared I’ll lose you soon and I’m trying to cling on in any way I can,” you admit.

“Oh you silly silly girl,” he kisses all over your face. “If I die, I wouldn’t want you tethered to me in such a way. I’d want you to move on.”

“I don’t want to, I want this,” you protest.

“If this is just to be more certain of us rather than you and Lucifer, Tabitha, do not risk your life. I would infinitely prefer you to go to the Devil for comfort than be ripped apart by my child.”

“That’s my choice to make,” you’re getting stubborn now.

“Please, my love,” he says softly. “I would never be happy knowing I’d condemned you a second time.”

“I’ll get Castiel to check me out. It takes quickly, right? Then I can see if it’s worth it. Just for now…indulge me. If all these visions are leading where I think they’re leading, I want something of you here still.”

“You are a hopeless romantic, Miss Hetherington,” his eyes twinkle a little. “And I don’t deserve such fierce love. Very well, I’ll do what you ask but if there’s the slightest sense of you dying, I’ll stop this in its tracks, understand?”

“Yes.”

“Now, where were we, ah yes. Here.”

He drives hard into you and you swear like a sailor, raking his back which makes him only pound harder. He’s chasing his release quickly, still keen not to get caught by anyone in the bunker.

“I love you, you idiotic hunter,” he breathes before pushing as far as he can go, spilling into you with a coarse grunt.

It’s much the same sensation as last time. There’s a soreness and pressure in your abdomen that wouldn’t usually happen with sex. You feel a lot hungrier already.

“It’s taken,” Crowley announces. “I still think you’re a bloody lunatic for doing this but I will never deny you what you want, my kitten. If this is to be my legacy then for the love of all things sacred, do not give them a traditional Scottish name.”

“Well what else goes with MacLeod?” you snort. “Or is the last name to be Crowley?”

“Oh please spare me the indignation of passing my family name down,” he rolls his eyes. “Use your own. It’s much more elegant.”

“Crowley I-”

“I know, pet, I know. I’m frightened too. Being told by your lover that you’ve got a time limit is not an easy thing to process.”

“I just didn’t want you unprepared.”

“Naturally,” he nods. “I can make preparations now. I assume I bite the dust during some prize fight with Lucifer so I hope it looks good at least. Does it happen….soon?”

“I think the closer I get the more visions I have.”

“Well….buggeration then.”



**

You rejoined the little hunting party in the bunker after that, beelining straight for Sam and Dean and giving them a hug. They return it wholeheartedly, squishing you all into a trio of limbs.

“Hey, good to see you too, princess,” Dean chuckles. “Miss us?”

“Oh definitely,” you roll your eyes. “I always love having somebody around to fight me for the last muffin in the morning.”

“Competition is healthy,” Dean winks.

“Pretty sure it’s not, Dean,” Sam sighs. “Everything okay with you? I know you had to face Toni again.”

“I almost shot her but I’m good,” you step back, trying to see if they were still around. “Do we have company or is it just us?”

“Just us but..uh….mom wants to speak to you,” Sam shifts awkwardly.

“What happened? Did something go wrong?”

“Nah, nothing like that,” Dean shakes his head. “Think she just wants to run something by you. She’s in the library.”

“Alright, I’ll swing by there now.”

“Good, I need to speak to Crowley about the Kelly situation.”

“Let’s have a little tête a tête then,” Crowley sits down at the table. “Pool our resources together because the last thing I want is an heir of Lucifer’s challenging my claim to the throne.”

You leave them to it, wandering into the library and seeing Mary looking over some gadgets and weapons that you know Mick has provided her. You missed having access to stuff like this but it also showed you didn’t need fancy items to get the job done.

“Ah good,” she smiles kindly at you. “Come here. I need a girl chat.”

“We’re not going to talk about boys, are we?” you hesitate. “Because I’m woefully inadequate in that area.”

“Well, for a start, you’re dating a demon and not a boy,” she laughs. “But I get your point. No, this is to do with the Men of Letters as a whole.”

“Were they okay with you? If they hurt you in any way-”

“I’m fine,” she places a hand on your shoulder. “I just….Mick’s a good guy. I think he really does actually wanna make a go of this alliance.”

“I’ve never had a problem with Mick,” you say honestly. “My problem is with Toni…and sometimes with Ketch depending on whether he’s chasing me or not.”

There was something about the way Mary’s eyes flashed when you mentioned Ketch that you couldn’t help but notice. It was strange, almost like…

“Are you….involved with Ketch?” you probe.

“Hunters,” she sighs. “They see everything. We may have….bonded whilst going to fetch my boys. He’s not as scary as his reputation.”

“I know he isn’t but he’s dangerous in other ways,” you say firmly, trying to make her understand. “He’s never fallen in love in the whole time I’ve known him and that’s almost some two decades now.”

“I’m not after love, sweetie. Just a connection. For me, it’s only been about a few weeks since I was with John, remember? Just promise me that you won’t tell Sam and Dean, okay? I don’t think they need to get protective.”

The only awkward thing is Mary keeps relying on you to cover for her whilst she sneaks off with Ketch. You feel a little like a high schooler, trying to protect a friend from their parents finding out.

Was this a dream? Was it just a dream? Could this be…a prophecy? Was this what was to come after the grey world?

“Hmmm, nah,” Lucifer shrugs. “He was mean to me. I don’t like mean people. Hey, here’s a neat idea. I’ll tell you something that Crowley did that’ll mean you don’t like him any more.”

Lucifer gives a moody pout before drumming his fingers on the arm rests of the throne, “Crowley, you’re no fun. I expected you to be more of a coward.”

“Bite me,” Crowley growls back, gritting his teeth through the pain.

“You know, I might, so don’t test me,” Lucifer snarls. “Fineeee, how about this then, Crowley? I’ve been sending sex dreams to Tabitha for weeks now and she just loves them, don’t you baby?”

“If by love you mean I want to claw my own brain out after them then yeah,” you hiss. “Why are you doing this to me? Why not shack up with Kelly?”

“Kelly was sweet and all but she had no fire,” Lucifer muses. “You, on the other hand, you’re the only human female in creation that’s told me no. You’re the only one who ever tried to understand me. You are the human I’m meant to have so if Crowley could just…I don’t know…die? Gee, that would be swell.”

Another crack as Crowley’s arm snaps in two and you’re trying to hold him as he falls sideways.

“Cas!” you shout.

“Oh, that’s disappointing,” Lucifer leans forward. “My little bro ain’t gonna help this. I’ll find you. I always will. I hope you’re good at being a stepmom by the way.”

There’s a flap of wings behind you before you’re deposited in the bunker, screaming your lungs out for the boys. There’s a crash as doors open and the running of footsteps before Sam, Dean and Mary burst into your bedroom.

“What the hell happened?!” Dean says in alarm, taking in Crowley’s near unconscious state.

“Lucifer,” Castiel says for you. “Appears he came for the throne of Hell. He’s in his old vessel.”

“Son of a bitch,” Dean mutters. “Everyone okay?”

“Peachy,” Crowley groans.

“He’s going to go after Kelly,” you tell Castiel. “He kept saying he wants me to be a stepmum to the kid. Go make sure she’s fine.”

The angel disappears.

“Tell us what the hell is going on, Tabitha,” Sam kneels down, helping you bring Crowley onto the bed.

“Crowley found Lucifer’s essence and stuffed it into a vessel that was bound with bits of the cage,” you rattle off. “Somehow he broke out of the control. He was meant to be contained until we could get Kelly’s kid but it didn’t work.”

“How long have you known this?” Dean asks suspiciously.

“Like a month,” you meet his gaze defiantly.

“Tabs, we said no more secrets,” Dean sighs long and hard. “Sweetheart, you need to start trusting us more. We could’ve helped.”

“Trust me, you couldn’t,” you stand up. “He would’ve said anything to you to rile you up.”

“So we need to go get to Kelly,” Mary cuts in. “That’s what I’m taking from this. Correct?”

“Yes, we need to move now. I assume Cas has told you about his plans?”

“Yeah but we still think he’s nuts for it,” Sam adds.

“I am perfectly stable,” Castiel says as he reappears. “Kelly says…uh…well she shouted that her water has broken. I need assistance.”

“Take us all,” you say firmly. “I think this is going to be the last stand off soon.”

“You’re not going anywhere without us,” Toni says from the doorway, flanked by Mick.

“Do you live here now?!” you hiss.

“Trust me, I wouldn’t choose to live somewhere this odious,” she curls her lip. “But you’re not letting a nephilim be born. It’s against the code.”

“She’s right, Tabitha,” Mick nods. “It’s too powerful.”

Toni holds up a gun whilst Mick uses a knife to slice open his palm, drawing the angel banishing sigil on the wall.

“Don’t you dare, you Brit dickbags!” Dean yells.

“Only way, mate,” Mick shrugs apologetically.

Before he can slam his hand on it, there’s two gunshots and blood explodes from their faces. They drop to the floor, bodies thudding heavily to reveal Ketch standing behind them.

“Jesus Christ!” you shout. “Arthur?!”

“Their termination orders had come through,” he says quaintly, imperceptibly nodding at Mary.

You knew that was bollocks. More likely he’d done it before he was afraid for Mary’s safety but it still shocked you. You looked away from the bodies on the floor, trying not to process it.

“Let’s go,” Castiel says, healing Crowley before gathering everyone in a circle once they had tooled up.

“Go Team Free Will,” Dean says grimly. “End of days part sixty five.”

“Everyone ready?” Sam asks.

“No,” you murmur quietly. “But let’s do this anyway.”

You give one last scared look to Crowley who returns it before you vanish out of the bunker.

“She asked me to,” Crowley holds up both hands. “Begged me to, in fact. So please, indulge me.”

“I’ve got my reasons,” you murmur. “Prophet type reasons.”

“Can’t ignore the word of God, can we?” Crowley chips in.

“I frequently have ignored the word of God,” Castiel moves to you. “I’m the 'rebel angel’, remember? God was not what I expected either.”

“Yes, yes, just assess her you monotonous twit,” Crowley rolls his eyes.

There’s a funny feeling as Castiel moves his hand over your stomach and you see the soft glow of a light underneath his fingers. He furrows his brow, concentrating hard until he steps back.

“You saw that the child lives?” Castiel asks.

“Yes. Lucifer mentioned something about ‘picking up his kid’.”

“Then it has to live. If we try to subvert fate, it could be catastrophic.”

“Feathers, leave us,” Crowley dismisses Castiel with a wave. “I need to talk to her alone.”

“Is this really all we have to look forward to?” he mutters. “I die and you become Lucifer’s plaything?”

You turn to see him, shirtless, his wings in a relaxed position. He’s just bathing in the flow of the sun like you are.

“You have no idea how happy you made me when you chose to come with me,” Lucifer murmurs softly.

“I’ll admit, at first I thought you were just obsessed. Like a teenage crush or something,” you hear your own voice say.

“No, Tabitha. It’s love,” he pushes your hair back behind your ear. “It’s a bond, it’s unity. You are mine and I am yours.”

Your hand drags up to the bridge of his wing before tracing gently through the feathers. He sighs contentedly, pulling you closer.

“I will never let you go,” he leans down, capturing your lips in a kiss.

Was this a dream? Was it just a dream? Could this be…a prophecy? Was this what was to come after the grey world?

Then it was like you’d blinked because one second you were upright and kissing him and the next you were on the bed. Lucifer was naked above you and you had no clothes on either. You might have been chilled to the bone with Lucifer’s temperature but somehow the baking sunlight coming through the windows was keeping you warm.

“It will be my honour to claim you as mine,” Lucifer smiles lopsidedly.

“Then do it,” your voice is full of lust.

“After I properly revere you.”

He wanted to explore every inch of you, mouthing at you, kissing you, biting you. You felt relaxed, you felt peaceful as his mouth hovered in between your legs.

“I never got to taste such a pure creature last time,” he smirks.

Then the scene flips again and there’s this almost heavy feeling in your legs like you get after an orgasm. Lucifer’s fully on top of you, cock ready and waiting as he searches your face for permission.

“Say yes to me, Tabitha. Say yes to being mine and I swear I will keep you safe for eternity. You will be mine, you’ll bear my family, you’ll fight alongside me against our enemies. Say yes.”

He kisses you hard and you can feel him press his cock to your entrance, holding himself back with great difficulty.

“Say yes to me.”

To your horror, the next words you say are, “Yes.”

The next sensation you feel is being full, so full you’re being stretched as he eases into you. How can you feel that with such perfect detail?!

“You make me so happy,” he murmurs before fully driving himself in to the hilt.

You’re just lucky Crowley wasn’t next to you because you know he would’ve heard your panicked thoughts just now. He didn’t need to know how much you were being tormented by this.

Did you enjoy that? Oh you did, you bad baaaaad girl. Come see what’s kickin’ in the throne room, Tabby. I’m sure you’ll love it.

You hastily scramble, pulling on jeans and a t-shirt before rushing out to the throne room, past several demons who give excited whispers. You throw open the double doors to see Crowley on the floor and Lucifer on the throne, one leg crooked over the arm rest.

“Hi cupcake,” he smiles sweetly at you.

“What’s going on?”

“Tabitha, get out!” Crowley roars through his pain.

Lucifer flicks his wrist and you hear an audible crack as Crowley’s back seems to bend unnaturally far backwards.

“Stop it!” you yell, running forward to grab him, to protect him.

“Hmmm, nah,” Lucifer shrugs. “He was mean to me. I don’t like mean people. Hey, here’s a neat idea. I’ll tell you something that Crowley did that’ll mean you don’t like him any more.”

“If it’s about my parents, I already know,” you fire back.

Lucifer gives a moody pout before drumming his fingers on the arm rests of the throne, “Crowley, you’re no fun. I expected you to be more of a coward.”

“Bite me,” Crowley growls back, gritting his teeth through the pain.

“You know, I might, so don’t test me,” Lucifer snarls. “Fineeee, how about this then, Crowley? I’ve been sending sex dreams to Tabitha for weeks now and she just loves them, don’t you baby?”

“If by love you mean I want to claw my own brain out after them then yeah,” you hiss. “Why are you doing this to me? Why not shack up with Kelly?”

“Kelly was sweet and all but she had no fire,” Lucifer muses. “You, on the other hand, you’re the only human female in creation that’s told me no. You’re the only one who ever tried to understand me. You are the human I’m meant to have so if Crowley could just…I don’t know…die? Gee, that would be swell.”

Another crack as Crowley’s arm snaps in two and you’re trying to hold him as he falls sideways.

“Cas!” you shout.

“Oh, that’s disappointing,” Lucifer leans forward. “My little bro ain’t gonna help this. I’ll find you. I always will. I hope you’re good at being a stepmom by the way.”

There’s a flap of wings behind you before you’re deposited in the bunker, screaming your lungs out for the boys. There’s a crash as doors open and the running of footsteps before Sam, Dean and Mary burst into your bedroom.

“What the hell happened?!” Dean says in alarm, taking in Crowley’s near unconscious state.

“Lucifer,” Castiel says for you. “Appears he came for the throne of Hell. He’s in his old vessel.”

“Son of a bitch,” Dean mutters. “Everyone okay?”

“Peachy,” Crowley groans.

“He’s going to go after Kelly,” you tell Castiel. “He kept saying he wants me to be a stepmum to the kid. Go make sure she’s fine.”

The angel disappears.

“Tell us what the hell is going on, Tabitha,” Sam kneels down, helping you bring Crowley onto the bed.

“Crowley found Lucifer’s essence and stuffed it into a vessel that was bound with bits of the cage,” you rattle off. “Somehow he broke out of the control. He was meant to be contained until we could get Kelly’s kid but it didn’t work.”

“How long have you known this?” Dean asks suspiciously.

“Like a month,” you meet his gaze defiantly.

“Tabs, we said no more secrets,” Dean sighs long and hard. “Sweetheart, you need to start trusting us more. We could’ve helped.”

“Trust me, you couldn’t,” you stand up. “He would’ve said anything to you to rile you up.”

“So we need to go get to Kelly,” Mary cuts in. “That’s what I’m taking from this. Correct?”

“Yes, we need to move now. I assume Cas has told you about his plans?”

“Yeah but we still think he’s nuts for it,” Sam adds.

“I am perfectly stable,” Castiel says as he reappears. “Kelly says…uh…well she shouted that her water has broken. I need assistance.”

“Take us all,” you say firmly. “I think this is going to be the last stand off soon.”

“You’re not going anywhere without us,” Toni says from the doorway, flanked by Mick.

“Do you live here now?!” you hiss.

“Trust me, I wouldn’t choose to live somewhere this odious,” she curls her lip. “But you’re not letting a nephilim be born. It’s against the code.”

“She’s right, Tabitha,” Mick nods. “It’s too powerful.”

Toni holds up a gun whilst Mick uses a knife to slice open his palm, drawing the angel banishing sigil on the wall.

“Don’t you dare, you Brit dickbags!” Dean yells.

“Only way, mate,” Mick shrugs apologetically.

Before he can slam his hand on it, there’s two gunshots and blood explodes from their faces. They drop to the floor, bodies thudding heavily to reveal Ketch standing behind them.

“Jesus Christ!” you shout. “Arthur?!”

“Their termination orders had come through,” he says quaintly, imperceptibly nodding at Mary.

You knew that was bollocks. More likely he’d done it before he was afraid for Mary’s safety but it still shocked you. You looked away from the bodies on the floor, trying not to process it.

“Let’s go,” Castiel says, healing Crowley before gathering everyone in a circle once they had tooled up.

“Go Team Free Will,” Dean says grimly. “End of days part sixty five.”

“Everyone ready?” Sam asks.

“No,” you murmur quietly. “But let’s do this anyway.”

You give one last scared look to Crowley who returns it before you vanish out of the bunker.

“Cas!” you shout.

“Oh, that’s disappointing,” Lucifer leans forward. “My little bro ain’t gonna help this. I’ll find you. I always will. I hope you’re good at being a stepmom by the way.”

There’s a flap of wings behind you before you’re deposited in the bunker, screaming your lungs out for the boys. There’s a crash as doors open and the running of footsteps before Sam, Dean and Mary burst into your bedroom.

“What the hell happened?!” Dean says in alarm, taking in Crowley’s near unconscious state.

“Lucifer,” Castiel says for you. “Appears he came for the throne of Hell. He’s in his old vessel.”

“Son of a bitch,” Dean mutters. “Everyone okay?”

“Peachy,” Crowley groans.

“He’s going to go after Kelly,” you tell Castiel. “He kept saying he wants me to be a stepmum to the kid. Go make sure she’s fine.”

The angel disappears.

“Tell us what the hell is going on, Tabitha,” Sam kneels down, helping you bring Crowley onto the bed.

“Crowley found Lucifer’s essence and stuffed it into a vessel that was bound with bits of the cage,” you rattle off. “Somehow he broke out of the control. He was meant to be contained until we could get Kelly’s kid but it didn’t work.”

“How long have you known this?” Dean asks suspiciously.

“Like a month,” you meet his gaze defiantly.

“Tabs, we said no more secrets,” Dean sighs long and hard. “Sweetheart, you need to start trusting us more. We could’ve helped.”

“Trust me, you couldn’t,” you stand up. “He would’ve said anything to you to rile you up.”

“So we need to go get to Kelly,” Mary cuts in. “That’s what I’m taking from this. Correct?”

“Yes, we need to move now. I assume Cas has told you about his plans?”

“Yeah but we still think he’s nuts for it,” Sam adds.

“I am perfectly stable,” Castiel says as he reappears. “Kelly says…uh…well she shouted that her water has broken. I need assistance.”

“Take us all,” you say firmly. “I think this is going to be the last stand off soon.”

“You’re not going anywhere without us,” Toni says from the doorway, flanked by Mick.

“Do you live here now?!” you hiss.

“Trust me, I wouldn’t choose to live somewhere this odious,” she curls her lip. “But you’re not letting a nephilim be born. It’s against the code.”

“She’s right, Tabitha,” Mick nods. “It’s too powerful.”

Toni holds up a gun whilst Mick uses a knife to slice open his palm, drawing the angel banishing sigil on the wall.

“Don’t you dare, you Brit dickbags!” Dean yells.

“Only way, mate,” Mick shrugs apologetically.

Before he can slam his hand on it, there’s two gunshots and blood explodes from their faces. They drop to the floor, bodies thudding heavily to reveal Ketch standing behind them.

“Jesus Christ!” you shout. “Arthur?!”

“Their termination orders had come through,” he says quaintly, imperceptibly nodding at Mary.

You knew that was bollocks. More likely he’d done it before he was afraid for Mary’s safety but it still shocked you. You looked away from the bodies on the floor, trying not to process it.

“Let’s go,” Castiel says, healing Crowley before gathering everyone in a circle once they had tooled up.

“Go Team Free Will,” Dean says grimly. “End of days part sixty five.”

“Everyone ready?” Sam asks.

“No,” you murmur quietly. “But let’s do this anyway.”

You give one last scared look to Crowley who returns it before you vanish out of the bunker.

_____

trail.content:
Chapter Summary: Crowley has something to tell you and Mary suggests an alliance.

Chapter Warnings: Smut, lots of smut. Angst

Chapter 47 - Overruled

(Proof reading errors likely)

A/N: This is a long ass chapter guys, Strap in.

________

“Oh Crowleyyyyy,” Lucifer had cooed to him telepathically as Crowley fucked you hard on the throne. “Let’s have a private chat, devil to demon.”

“Get stuffed,” Crowley thought back. “Busy here.”

“You’re gonna listen because I know you still haven’t told her about her parents yet,” comes the derisive response. “This will be the last time you touch her. Let me out of the bonds of this vessel and I’ll spare your miserable existence. Don’t and I’ll sing like a canary.”

“Go ahead,” Crowley mentally shrugs. “Try it.”

He watches Lucifer bluster for a split second before an expression of rage comes over his face and then he focuses his attention back to you.

Crowley knew he was trying to converse with you in a similar manner. He couldn’t read your thoughts any more because of it. He just hoped you’d be strong enough to resist his charms this time.

He uses his essence to help your orgasm along, trying to rip you out of the internal conversation and he grunts as he feels you clench and pulse around him. Then he can hear your thoughts again.

“He’s never going to stop,” you kept thinking over and over. “He’ll never stop until he has me.”

Of all the things in creation that you’d fought, Crowley knew Lucifer’s obsession with you scared you the most. Not even a display like this had been a big enough clue for the idiot feather duster that you didn’t want him.

Then he found his own release, his cock twitching inside you. You always felt marvellous around him. So tight, so willing.

Then Crowley’s mouth gets the better of him and he’s in a war of words with Lucifer, causing the archangel to bristle. That seemed to make you stiffen to an unnatural degree before Crowley leaned around and saw your eyes glaze over.

“If it saves the world Dean, what choice do I have? I’ll go with him,” you say dully.

“I wonder if she’s talking about little old me,” Lucifer grins cheekily, looking at Crowley out of the tops of his eyes. “I’d like to think she’d come round to my way of thinking eventually.”

“I don’t want to run. Don’t make me,” you start picking up speed in your babbling and Crowley knew he needed to get you out before Lucifer took this as a sign of victory.

He appeared with you in the bedroom, quite beside himself with worry as he held you close, listening to horrible things that you were predicting. They were things that told him there was a choice to make, a choice to save humanity but it was likely that either meant you went with Lucifer or Crowley died. Neither of those were appealing. Neither of those he could bear to listen to as you sounded like you were imitating a sobbing voice, your voice from the future.

Well….bloody hell.



**



After your phone conversation with Dean, Crowley seems to be looking at you intensely.

“Darling, there’s something I need to tell you,” Crowley starts.

“What did you do this time?” you automatically say, feeling your stomach flip. “You never use that voice unless you messed up.”

“It’s something I found out very very recently,” he sighs. “I just needed to confirm if it was true or not.”

“Tell me.”

“Tabitha, this might change things between us.”

“I feel like I’m in this for the long game now,” you laugh a little bitterly. “So just get it over with. Who is she?”

“Excuse me?” Crowley blinks. “Who is who?”

“Oh,” your eyes widen. “Okay, you didn’t stray then, that’s something.”

“Why on earth would I do that, you certifiable woman?” Crowley is bewildered. “Why would that even enter your mind?”

“Something Lucifer said to me just now,” you bite your lip, looking at the sheets.

“Is he speaking to you telepathically?” Crowley becomes very angry. “Abominable git! Pet, you are the top of the chain and why would I try and find anything as good as that when there isn’t? No I haven’t betrayed you. This is to do with your parents.”

“What about them?”

“I mean your real parents,” Crowley sighs again. “Before you and Alistair were adopted.”

“You mean….did you….did you kill them or something?”

“Your mother, she made a deal,” Crowley tells you. “She couldn’t have children, see. She asked for ten years of fertility so I gave them to her. That’s how you and your brother came to be. When it was time to collect….there were more casualties than was expected. It was the Marchioness disaster.”

“So you’re saying you had a hand in my birth?” you try and wrap your head around it. “I’m not sure whether that’s creepy or fate at this point.”

“You know, I was expecting rather more shouting than is currently happening,” Crowley surveys you.

“I…I don’t know,” you shrug. “I never knew my birth parents. It would be unfair of me to get angry over something like this. You didn’t know I would be the product of it. I can’t hate you for a decision my mother made.”

You’d never seen the King of Hell relax as much as he did. Crowley almost fell back into the sheets with relief.

“Darling, I love you. You are just the most exquisite example of mortal divinity.”

“If you’re going to suggest they’ll make me a saint again after I die, I’ll throw this pillow at you,” you scowl. “I’m nobody’s angel. I just fucked a demon in front of the devil.”

“That you did,” Crowley purrs, running a hand along your waist. “Very bold and very brave. I know he was trying to speak to you most of the time. Is he saying anything now?”

“Only the usual,” you mutter. “That he’ll kill you, he’ll kill the Winchesters and I’ll be some queen of the dawn or other.”

“Not if I kill him first,” Crowley grumbles. “I’ll pluck him and roast him like a Christmas turkey.”

You wince, hearing that saccharin voice of Lucifer’s invading your head again.

Tabbbbbbyyyyyyyyy, oh my little cutesy wutesy little kitty cat? Answer me baby. Did you like my show for you? I promise you, tonight’s will be even better.

“He won’t shut up,” you hiss, clenching your hands over your ears. “I feel like I’m going mad.”

“Let’s get you out of Hell. Distance will help,” Crowley frowns, redressing you with a snap of his fingers and then vanishing with you back into the bunker.

Immediately the archangel’s voice dims to where you can’t even make out individual words. The relief was immense.

“Thank you,” you say earnestly. “Being a prophet sucks balls.”

“Such an interesting turn of phrase,” Crowley chuckles. “And yes, I’ll never forgive God for pulling that little stunt.”

There’s a flash where you see Crowley in the grey world, screaming in agony before it’s gone just as suddenly as it started. The more you keep seeing, the more you’re certain you’re going to lose him. You just want to shirk all your hunter responsibilities, spend as much time with Crowley as you can. Then a mad idea comes to you.

“Take me again,” you nip at his neck.

“Already? Darling,  I’m not a machine.”

“So you’re not up to it?” you tease.

“I may not be a machine but I am Crowley and I am always up for ravishing you. What’s brought this mood on?”

“I just need you again.”

There’s a click and you’re disrobed before you practically pounce on him. He seems shocked at first but he play fights with you, pinning you to the bed with his demonic essence.

“Wicked girl,” he smirks. “And all mine.”

“Crowley, just fuck me,” you beg.

“How can I refuse such a pretty request like that?”

You’re still slick from the sex you had earlier and he has no trouble gliding his cock into you, stretching you out around him.

“But let’s aim for a quickie,” he whispers in your ear. “I’m fairly certain there’s the Winchester brood not so far away and your old colleagues.”

“Then come on,” you grab his hips, urging him to roll forward.

“Very very eager,” he purrs. “My my.”

He covers your mouth with his hand before taking an almost feral pace. He’s driving himself home, desperately trying to keep his own sounds to small groans and curse words in a language you don’t understand.

“Let’s take the quick method for you, my love,” he rasps and you can see the tendrils of his power snake across your body, feeling like hands were pawing at every inch of you. “Come now, I want to feel you shake in my arms.”

He mouths at your neck, leaving tiny bites in his wake until you jerk, your orgasm barrelling across you as you half scream into his palm.

“Oh I do love those noises you make, kitten,” he groans. “I shan’t be far behind.”

“Crowley, do what you did when Lucifer was riding shotgun,” you say seriously. “Switch off the thing that makes you infertile.”

He stops dead, looking horrified, “Absolutely not! Are you bloody mad?! I almost killed you the last time!”

“And Chuck said I wouldn’t have survived that time but didn’t say I would never survive it,” you argue. “Please.”

“Why are you so insistent, darling?” he looks grave.

“Because I’m scared I’ll lose you soon and I’m trying to cling on in any way I can,” you admit.

“Oh you silly silly girl,” he kisses all over your face. “If I die, I wouldn’t want you tethered to me in such a way. I’d want you to move on.”

“I don’t want to, I want this,” you protest.

“If this is just to be more certain of us rather than you and Lucifer, Tabitha, do not risk your life. I would infinitely prefer you to go to the Devil for comfort than be ripped apart by my child.”

“That’s my choice to make,” you’re getting stubborn now.

“Please, my love,” he says softly. “I would never be happy knowing I’d condemned you a second time.”

“I’ll get Castiel to check me out. It takes quickly, right? Then I can see if it’s worth it. Just for now…indulge me. If all these visions are leading where I think they’re leading, I want something of you here still.”

“You are a hopeless romantic, Miss Hetherington,” his eyes twinkle a little. “And I don’t deserve such fierce love. Very well, I’ll do what you ask but if there’s the slightest sense of you dying, I’ll stop this in its tracks, understand?”

“Yes.”

“Now, where were we, ah yes. Here.”

He drives hard into you and you swear like a sailor, raking his back which makes him only pound harder. He’s chasing his release quickly, still keen not to get caught by anyone in the bunker.

“I love you, you idiotic hunter,” he breathes before pushing as far as he can go, spilling into you with a coarse grunt.

It’s much the same sensation as last time. There’s a soreness and pressure in your abdomen that wouldn’t usually happen with sex. You feel a lot hungrier already.

“It’s taken,” Crowley announces. “I still think you’re a bloody lunatic for doing this but I will never deny you what you want, my kitten. If this is to be my legacy then for the love of all things sacred, do not give them a traditional Scottish name.”

“Well what else goes with MacLeod?” you snort. “Or is the last name to be Crowley?”

“Oh please spare me the indignation of passing my family name down,” he rolls his eyes. “Use your own. It’s much more elegant.”

“Crowley I-”

“I know, pet, I know. I’m frightened too. Being told by your lover that you’ve got a time limit is not an easy thing to process.”

“I just didn’t want you unprepared.”

“Naturally,” he nods. “I can make preparations now. I assume I bite the dust during some prize fight with Lucifer so I hope it looks good at least. Does it happen….soon?”

“I think the closer I get the more visions I have.”

“Well….buggeration then.”



**

You rejoined the little hunting party in the bunker after that, beelining straight for Sam and Dean and giving them a hug. They return it wholeheartedly, squishing you all into a trio of limbs.

“Hey, good to see you too, princess,” Dean chuckles. “Miss us?”

“Oh definitely,” you roll your eyes. “I always love having somebody around to fight me for the last muffin in the morning.”

“Competition is healthy,” Dean winks.

“Pretty sure it’s not, Dean,” Sam sighs. “Everything okay with you? I know you had to face Toni again.”

“I almost shot her but I’m good,” you step back, trying to see if they were still around. “Do we have company or is it just us?”

“Just us but..uh….mom wants to speak to you,” Sam shifts awkwardly.

“What happened? Did something go wrong?”

“Nah, nothing like that,” Dean shakes his head. “Think she just wants to run something by you. She’s in the library.”

“Alright, I’ll swing by there now.”

“Good, I need to speak to Crowley about the Kelly situation.”

“Let’s have a little tête a tête then,” Crowley sits down at the table. “Pool our resources together because the last thing I want is an heir of Lucifer’s challenging my claim to the throne.”

You leave them to it, wandering into the library and seeing Mary looking over some gadgets and weapons that you know Mick has provided her. You missed having access to stuff like this but it also showed you didn’t need fancy items to get the job done.

“Ah good,” she smiles kindly at you. “Come here. I need a girl chat.”

“We’re not going to talk about boys, are we?” you hesitate. “Because I’m woefully inadequate in that area.”

“Well, for a start, you’re dating a demon and not a boy,” she laughs. “But I get your point. No, this is to do with the Men of Letters as a whole.”

“Were they okay with you? If they hurt you in any way-”

“I’m fine,” she places a hand on your shoulder. “I just….Mick’s a good guy. I think he really does actually wanna make a go of this alliance.”

“I’ve never had a problem with Mick,” you say honestly. “My problem is with Toni…and sometimes with Ketch depending on whether he’s chasing me or not.”

There was something about the way Mary’s eyes flashed when you mentioned Ketch that you couldn’t help but notice. It was strange, almost like…

“Are you….involved with Ketch?” you probe.

“Hunters,” she sighs. “They see everything. We may have….bonded whilst going to fetch my boys. He’s not as scary as his reputation.”

“I know he isn’t but he’s dangerous in other ways,” you say firmly, trying to make her understand. “He’s never fallen in love in the whole time I’ve known him and that’s almost some two decades now.”

“I’m not after love, sweetie. Just a connection. For me, it’s only been about a few weeks since I was with John, remember? Just promise me that you won’t tell Sam and Dean, okay? I don’t think they need to get protective.”

“It’s not my place to tell them. If you really want this alliance then I’ll go along with it but I really can’t promise I won’t shoot Toni if she gets out of line. There’s something bad coming and it makes her petty jealously look incredibly insignificant in the grand scheme of things.”

“How bad?” Mary’s face falls.

“Someone’s going to die and I’m not sure whether it’ll be me or Crowley,” you confide in her. “Please don’t tell anyone that either. A secret for a secret.”

“Tabitha, I’ll try my damnedest to make sure that doesn’t happen. You’re becoming part of the family, I mean, hell you’re already a part of Dean and Sam’s family.”

“Well if we’re all keeping secrets then yeah, I’m a Winchester,” you laugh.

“Sometimes I wish we were a normal family again,” Mary looks off wistfully. “I miss those days I used to cook Dean pancakes and read to Sam at night. Azazel stole my best years with them.”

“Now you have a chance to reconnect.”

She puts her arm around your shoulders, squashing you to her fondly, “You’re right. Now, tell me everything about these prophecies you have. I’ll see if there’s anything I can do to help.”



**

Five weeks pass and Lucifer never delivers on his promise to give you a ‘show’. In fact, you don’t dream at all in that time.

You go on hunts with Sam, Dean, Mary and Ketch. Toni is left behind on your insistence, helping Mick to wrangle the American hunter network that you’ve told them about, giving over your contact lists.

Surprisingly it works well. The access to the gadgets makes hunting so much easier and what would have taken four days takes one. The database of lore from the Cambridge headquarters speeds up research time also, although Mick primarily takes charge of that for you.

The only awkward thing is Mary keeps relying on you to cover for her whilst she sneaks off with Ketch. You feel a little like a high schooler, trying to protect a friend from their parents finding out.

Crowley keeps visiting often, checking in on how you’re doing and bringing you to Hell where he can lie with you some nights. With all the increase in monster activity, you’ve both not be able to get five minutes to call Castiel to assess you but as you’re cuddled into Crowley’s arms, stark naked under the silk sheets, you get the shock of your life when the angel appears at the foot of the bed.

“Really, Feathers, I think you’re starting to enjoy this,” Crowley raises an eyebrow. “You have a habit of dropping in when clothing’s been shed.”

“There was no time to send warning. Fabric is immaterial to the conversation,” Castiel says in a slightly more animated voice than usual. “I have Kelly Kline.”

“In your trenchcoat pocket?” Crowley sasses.

“Obviously not,” the angel frowns. “In a safe location. I need to speak with Tabitha before I consult Sam and Dean. I feel she would be more receptive to what I have to say.”

“Of course, of course,” Crowley waves his hand. “But I would like you to do something for her.”

“Anything.”

“I’m pregnant again,” you take a deep breath. “Crowley wants to know if I’ll survive it.”

You’ve never seen quite an expression like it on Castiel’s face. It’s almost like a disappointed parent.

“Crowley, how is this keeping her safe like our agreement?”

“She asked me to,” Crowley holds up both hands. “Begged me to, in fact. So please, indulge me.”

“Why would you choose this?” Castiel seems baffled.

“I’ve got my reasons,” you murmur. “Prophet type reasons.”

“Can’t ignore the word of God, can we?” Crowley chips in.

“I frequently have ignored the word of God,” Castiel moves to you. “I’m the 'rebel angel’, remember? God was not what I expected either.”

“Yes, yes, just assess her you monotonous twit,” Crowley rolls his eyes.

There’s a funny feeling as Castiel moves his hand over your stomach and you see the soft glow of a light underneath his fingers. He furrows his brow, concentrating hard until he steps back.

“I don’t believe you’re dying this time. When Lucifer was in my vessel, he did this and the sensation is different.”

“So she’ll survive it?”

“I believe so, providing nothing kills her beforehand.”

“Ever the ray of sunshine,” Crowley sighs before kissing your forehead. “Well that’s one blessed relief.”

“What did you want to talk to me about, Cas?” you ask. “I can’t exactly get up right now.”

“I have seen naked humans before. I was there at the creation,” Castiel says bluntly. “But I understand your discomfort. Very well, my issue is that I do not want to kill Kelly’s baby.”

“I’m sorry, come again?” Crowley blinks. “A nephilim and you don’t want to smite it?”

“He’s different.”

“He?” you’re confused.

“When I found Kelly, she had attempted suicide. She was being held by Dagon. Evidently Crowley, you are not keeping favour in Hell. The Princes are trying to protect the baby.”

“Get to the point, Cas,” you interrupt.

“Yes, well then. The baby brought Kelly back to life and showed me a future where peace reigned. I believe this child will help the world. I cannot destroy it. The reason I am telling you, Tabitha, is because you understand. You believe in Crowley so much you want to try and have his child again even though he is a demon. Do you think your child would be inherently evil?”

“I don’t know. I would like to believe in nurture versus nature. There are monsters that can reject their nature out there.”

“This is my point. Nephilims from any other angel would not be considered evil but there is an assumption that because it is Lucifer’s that it will be bad,” Castiel nods. “This child is not bad. This child is good, I can see that. Can you trust my judgement?”

“Darling,” Crowley cuts in. “This is Lucifer’s child. Think very carefully. If you let it live, if Lucifer lives-”

“It was in one of my visions,” you sigh.

“You saw that the child lives?” Castiel asks.

“Yes. Lucifer mentioned something about ‘picking up his kid’.”

“Then it has to live. If we try to subvert fate, it could be catastrophic.”

“But the end result is catastrophic according to her visions. If we have a chance to change the course of destiny then why not?” Crowley becomes frustrated. “Let’s eliminate one of the variables right now.”

“But if this variable brings peace and balance then that is selfish,” Castiel matches his tone. “How did you feel when God killed your child?”

There’s a streak of colour that goes across your vision and a blur of red as you realise Crowley has launched himself at the angel, dragging the bedsheets along with him. You manage to whip a pillow in front of you to keep your modesty before rushing to the chair where Crowley’s overcoat is, rapidly pulling it onto yourself before you try and intervene.

“How dare you!” Crowley roars, fighting with Castiel, completely naked, grabbing him into a headlock. “Do not use my own tragedy for your idiotic arguments! You divine pond scum!”

“Crowley, stop it!” you yell, trying to pull him off but Crowley was infinitely stronger than you were.

“I ought to rip you apart!” Crowley continues shouting whilst Castiel struggles out of his grip.

“I’m trying to save humanity!” Castiel chokes out.

“Do so on your own dime, you insensitive wretch!”

“STOP FIGHTING!” you get in the middle of them. “Cas made a mistake, okay. It was a poor choice of words.”

“You’re lucky she’s here,” Crowley snarls, pointing at Castiel.

“Go get some scotch and calm down,” you send him out.

Crowley glares before snapping some clothes on himself and stalking out. You take a deep breath before turning to the angel who was profoundly ruffled.

“You don’t know what you’re asking of him,” you straighten out his tie. “My visions have been leading me to the conclusion that if things play out then Crowley dies and I might have to go with Lucifer.”

“Ah. Forgive me, I did not know.”

“So you’re asking him to choose between the child’s death or his death and my possible enslavement. He’s not going to readily agree.”

“Can I show you? I just need someone to understand me,” he holds out two fingers hesitantly.

“Alright then.”

It’s hard to describe the scene you see. It’s overwhelming in a way. You just know an innate sense of peace, of relaxation. It’s like you’re standing on top of a mountain watching the sun rise. It’s just…hopeful.

“This is the vision the child gave to me. That is his intentions. He only wants to help. He…uh….wants me to mentor him.”

“He wants you to be his dad instead?” you blink as the room comes back into focus.

“In a sense,” Castiel nods. “But that is what I want to fight for.”

“Can he keep me and Crowley safe?” you ask.

“If he senses no ill will from you then yes he will because I will tell him you are good people…well, you are a good person. Your child will no doubt be a good person.”

“If this is the gamble we have to take to bring everlasting peace….I suppose I’ve nearly died for less,” you take a breath.

“Thank you,” the angel grabs your shoulders, looking at you intensely. “I knew you would understand me. You are my greatest friend.”

“You don’t need to butter me up, you know. I already agreed.”

“You agreed?” comes Crowley’s voice as he returns with a large bottle of Craig he’s drinking directly from. “I could swear you’ve lost your marbles lately, kitten.”

“This nephilim can keep us safe,” you reiterate. “Honestly, this is the most hopeful I’ve been since I started having these stupid prophecies.”

Crowley’s face falls a little at that. He knows he can’t argue. Anything to cling onto was better than blind faith that the world would right itself.

“Feathers, leave us,” Crowley dismisses Castiel with a wave. “I need to talk to her alone.”

“Very well. I will update Tabitha on how Kelly is progressing and keep an eye on her own pregnancy also.”

Then he vanishes.

Crowley just stands there, one hand massaging his temple. He looks weary, older.

“Is this really all we have to look forward to?” he mutters. “I die and you become Lucifer’s plaything?”

“What choice do we have? You know how fighting destiny goes. It’s only subvertable at the last second with the Winchesters involved.”

Crowley snorts inelegantly, “Fair point, well made. Well….at least there is one glimmer of hope now. If you believe this child can help, I trust you. At least mine will not kill you. I can take great stock that my legacy will live on.”

“Boy or girl?”

“Doesn’t matter,” he comes over to you, kissing you so messily you can taste the alcohol. “Anything as long as it’s ours.”

“I love you. You know that right?”

“Darling, I don’t think there was a grand enough gesture like suicidally getting me to knock you up just so you could keep something of me around,” he smirks. “Makes a demon feel wanted. Now, I must insist that if I am to get the rest of this pent up energy out that I thoroughly fuck you right here and now in my coat because it looks simply criminal on you.”

The next thing you know you’re being thrown on the bed.



**

“Oh Tabbbbbyyyyyy,” comes that voice.

“Go away,” you hiss.

“Aww come on, sweetcheeks. I gave you a few weeks reprieve. Wasn’t that kind of me?” Lucifer pouts. “I hear we’re getting to the endgame. These demons looooove to gossip. You’ve been having visions about me, haven’t you? Visions where you come to me of your own free will?”

“GO AWAY!” you say more strongly.

“Nuh uh,” he wags a finger. “See, I remember your reaction when I projected that little image into your nugget. You weren’t exactly horrified. I didn’t ruin your fun with Crowley. That says to me that on some level, you enjoyed it.”

“Just stop hounding me.”

“Don’t deny yourself what you want,” he’s approaching you. “You want me. I know you do. You’re just scared of hurting Crowley.”

“I’m not-”

Then the world dissolves into that room. You’re by a large bay window, the doors open wide as the summer breeze tickles at your skin. You can feel the heat, magnified through the glass, bathing you as you look out at the view.

“My love,” Lucifer says from behind you.

You turn to see him, shirtless, his wings in a relaxed position. He’s just bathing in the flow of the sun like you are.

You can’t control your actions as you move towards him, placing a hand on his chest and snaking it up to his neck. You usually have a modicum of control in these kind of dreams but it’s like you’re viewing a movie through your own perspective.

“You have no idea how happy you made me when you chose to come with me,” Lucifer murmurs softly.

“I’ll admit, at first I thought you were just obsessed. Like a teenage crush or something,” you hear your own voice say.

“No, Tabitha. It’s love,” he pushes your hair back behind your ear. “It’s a bond, it’s unity. You are mine and I am yours.”

Your hand drags up to the bridge of his wing before tracing gently through the feathers. He sighs contentedly, pulling you closer.

“I will never let you go,” he leans down, capturing your lips in a kiss.

Surely dreams should not be this tactile? Surely you should not be able to feel the warmth of his breath, the caress of his fingers, the chill of his skin? You also caught a waft of scent now and then as his wings rippled, the smell of a warm summer’s evening.

Was this a dream? Was it just a dream? Could this be…a prophecy? Was this what was to come after the grey world?

You found your emotions getting more and more tangled as Lucifer deepened the kiss and you remembered the last time you’d done this, when you’d done this willingly. It was confusing knowing how serene and almost gentleman-like he could be contrasted with his vicious and spiteful side.

Then it was like you’d blinked because one second you were upright and kissing him and the next you were on the bed. Lucifer was naked above you and you had no clothes on either. You might have been chilled to the bone with Lucifer’s temperature but somehow the baking sunlight coming through the windows was keeping you warm.

“It will be my honour to claim you as mine,” Lucifer smiles lopsidedly.

“Then do it,” your voice is full of lust.

“After I properly revere you.”

He wanted to explore every inch of you, mouthing at you, kissing you, biting you. You felt relaxed, you felt peaceful as his mouth hovered in between your legs.

“I never got to taste such a pure creature last time,” he smirks.

Then the scene flips again and there’s this almost heavy feeling in your legs like you get after an orgasm. Lucifer’s fully on top of you, cock ready and waiting as he searches your face for permission.

“Say yes to me, Tabitha. Say yes to being mine and I swear I will keep you safe for eternity. You will be mine, you’ll bear my family, you’ll fight alongside me against our enemies. Say yes.”

He kisses you hard and you can feel him press his cock to your entrance, holding himself back with great difficulty.

“Say yes to me.”

To your horror, the next words you say are, “Yes.”

The next sensation you feel is being full, so full you’re being stretched as he eases into you. How can you feel that with such perfect detail?!

“You make me so happy,” he murmurs before fully driving himself in to the hilt.



**

You awake with a start, flailing as though the spectre of the Dream Lucifer could be pushed off you. You’re mortified to realise there’s a dull throbbing ache between your legs, that you got aroused by what you had seen.

You’re just lucky Crowley wasn’t next to you because you know he would’ve heard your panicked thoughts just now. He didn’t need to know how much you were being tormented by this.

Did you enjoy that? Oh you did, you bad baaaaad girl. Come see what’s kickin’ in the throne room, Tabby. I’m sure you’ll love it.

You hastily scramble, pulling on jeans and a t-shirt before rushing out to the throne room, past several demons who give excited whispers. You throw open the double doors to see Crowley on the floor and Lucifer on the throne, one leg crooked over the arm rest.

“Hi cupcake,” he smiles sweetly at you.

“What’s going on?”

“Tabitha, get out!” Crowley roars through his pain.

Lucifer flicks his wrist and you hear an audible crack as Crowley’s back seems to bend unnaturally far backwards.

“Stop it!” you yell, running forward to grab him, to protect him.

“Hmmm, nah,” Lucifer shrugs. “He was mean to me. I don’t like mean people. Hey, here’s a neat idea. I’ll tell you something that Crowley did that’ll mean you don’t like him any more.”

“If it’s about my parents, I already know,” you fire back.

Lucifer gives a moody pout before drumming his fingers on the arm rests of the throne, “Crowley, you’re no fun. I expected you to be more of a coward.”

“Bite me,” Crowley growls back, gritting his teeth through the pain.

“You know, I might, so don’t test me,” Lucifer snarls. “Fineeee, how about this then, Crowley? I’ve been sending sex dreams to Tabitha for weeks now and she just loves them, don’t you baby?”

“If by love you mean I want to claw my own brain out after them then yeah,” you hiss. “Why are you doing this to me? Why not shack up with Kelly?”

“Kelly was sweet and all but she had no fire,” Lucifer muses. “You, on the other hand, you’re the only human female in creation that’s told me no. You’re the only one who ever tried to understand me. You are the human I’m meant to have so if Crowley could just…I don’t know…die? Gee, that would be swell.”

Another crack as Crowley’s arm snaps in two and you’re trying to hold him as he falls sideways.

“Cas!” you shout.

“Oh, that’s disappointing,” Lucifer leans forward. “My little bro ain’t gonna help this. I’ll find you. I always will. I hope you’re good at being a stepmom by the way.”

There’s a flap of wings behind you before you’re deposited in the bunker, screaming your lungs out for the boys. There’s a crash as doors open and the running of footsteps before Sam, Dean and Mary burst into your bedroom.

“What the hell happened?!” Dean says in alarm, taking in Crowley’s near unconscious state.

“Lucifer,” Castiel says for you. “Appears he came for the throne of Hell. He’s in his old vessel.”

“Son of a bitch,” Dean mutters. “Everyone okay?”

“Peachy,” Crowley groans.

“He’s going to go after Kelly,” you tell Castiel. “He kept saying he wants me to be a stepmum to the kid. Go make sure she’s fine.”

The angel disappears.

“Tell us what the hell is going on, Tabitha,” Sam kneels down, helping you bring Crowley onto the bed.

“Crowley found Lucifer’s essence and stuffed it into a vessel that was bound with bits of the cage,” you rattle off. “Somehow he broke out of the control. He was meant to be contained until we could get Kelly’s kid but it didn’t work.”

“How long have you known this?” Dean asks suspiciously.

“Like a month,” you meet his gaze defiantly.

“Tabs, we said no more secrets,” Dean sighs long and hard. “Sweetheart, you need to start trusting us more. We could’ve helped.”

“Trust me, you couldn’t,” you stand up. “He would’ve said anything to you to rile you up.”

“So we need to go get to Kelly,” Mary cuts in. “That’s what I’m taking from this. Correct?”

“Yes, we need to move now. I assume Cas has told you about his plans?”

“Yeah but we still think he’s nuts for it,” Sam adds.

“I am perfectly stable,” Castiel says as he reappears. “Kelly says…uh…well she shouted that her water has broken. I need assistance.”

“Take us all,” you say firmly. “I think this is going to be the last stand off soon.”

“You’re not going anywhere without us,” Toni says from the doorway, flanked by Mick.

“Do you live here now?!” you hiss.

“Trust me, I wouldn’t choose to live somewhere this odious,” she curls her lip. “But you’re not letting a nephilim be born. It’s against the code.”

“She’s right, Tabitha,” Mick nods. “It’s too powerful.”

Toni holds up a gun whilst Mick uses a knife to slice open his palm, drawing the angel banishing sigil on the wall.

“Don’t you dare, you Brit dickbags!” Dean yells.

“Only way, mate,” Mick shrugs apologetically.

Before he can slam his hand on it, there’s two gunshots and blood explodes from their faces. They drop to the floor, bodies thudding heavily to reveal Ketch standing behind them.

“Jesus Christ!” you shout. “Arthur?!”

“Their termination orders had come through,” he says quaintly, imperceptibly nodding at Mary.

You knew that was bollocks. More likely he’d done it before he was afraid for Mary’s safety but it still shocked you. You looked away from the bodies on the floor, trying not to process it.

“Let’s go,” Castiel says, healing Crowley before gathering everyone in a circle once they had tooled up.

“Go Team Free Will,” Dean says grimly. “End of days part sixty five.”

“Everyone ready?” Sam asks.

“No,” you murmur quietly. “But let’s do this anyway.”

You give one last scared look to Crowley who returns it before you vanish out of the bunker.

“Get stuffed,” Crowley thought back. “Busy here.”

“You’re gonna listen because I know you still haven’t told her about her parents yet,” comes the derisive response. “This will be the last time you touch her. Let me out of the bonds of this vessel and I’ll spare your miserable existence. Don’t and I’ll sing like a canary.”

“Go ahead,” Crowley mentally shrugs. “Try it.”

He watches Lucifer bluster for a split second before an expression of rage comes over his face and then he focuses his attention back to you.

Crowley knew he was trying to converse with you in a similar manner. He couldn’t read your thoughts any more because of it. He just hoped you’d be strong enough to resist his charms this time.

He twisted his hips, shoving Crowley further up against the bed, and Crowley keened, grabbing uselessly at the sheets and dragging at them as he felt Aziraphale drag over his prostate with brutal, fastidious, angelic accuracy. “My dearest,” Aziraphale purred in his ear, and then dragged his teeth over the side of Crowley’s neck, “I had no idea.”

“Oh,” Crowley moaned, “love you, angel, love you–”

“I love you too, dear,” Aziraphale murmured, and then he bit down on Crowley’s shoulder, and Crowley choked on air.
